text: The former boss of NSW Labor claims then-Opposition leader Bill Shorten was aware of donations from sources linked to the Chinese community during the 2016 federal election campaign. In an exclusive interview with Sky News, former NSW Labor boss Jamie Clements claimed Mr Shorten and other MPs "of course" knew about the handouts. “It was Bill Shorten's campaign to become prime minister those donations were funding," he said. Mr Clements is now calling for the party to reform and has provided a written submission to the party's internal review. A spokesperson for the former federal Labor leader told Sky News “Bill Shorten was the first party leader to ban foreign donations from these guys, before the Liberals. Image: News Corp Australia
